content.description:
Hard start on a crimp and small pocket. Move up and right through larger pockets to a blank section of wall. Commit to the next move to grab a ledge. Rock is very dirty here and makes scoops hard to hold. Crux spot here. Once through this section easy climbing to top.

Alternate start out right to add a bit more challenge to the climb.
content.protection: Top rope from fixed anchor on top of cliff. Bring webbing or static rope for setup.
content.location: Right most route at yellow if looking at the cliff.

content.description: Is the large block behind which forms the cave is stemmed it the rating is 5.8, and if the face is used the difficulty is increased to 5.9.
involves some under-cling to surmount the bulge and gain the face.

It used to be taller but the top of the face broke off, fell, and is leaning up against the wall. The broken piece makes for a good little boulder traverse. (There is a bolt or two located on it so you can see where there may have been some leading in the past) 

  This route is comparable to the more difficult pink route and the face that fall off as well as a nearby tree can "assist" is you're having issues by wedging your way up
content.location: From the Wingo parking lot take a left at the observer deck and it is the last set of routes in this area.

content.description: The Yellow area has three anchor points, and climbs range in difficulty from 5.8- 5.11 depending on where you setup your rope. This area can be setup to allow for stemming between the main wall and a small boulder.Â
